intro: Roldana petasitis var. oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxacan roldana, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and often hairy foliage. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
